content: little hathi pattern written and designed by yvonne van zijl @bokkyshome 2021 in many cultures the elephant is a symbol of strength wisdom friendliness happiness and longevity doesn t that make this crocheted elephant a perfect gift to give terminology us terms hook 3 5 finished size 10 5 cm high 12 cm long depending on yarn and hook used skill level adventurous beginner yardage 70 m materials i used 20 g of katia fair cotton a pair of scissors a darning needle scrap yarn and matching hook stuffing material you can use any yarn with a hook size that is smaller than you would usually use in amigurumi your work needs to be a bit tighter so that stuffing will not pop out using different yarn and different size hook will only effect the size of hathi used abbreviations magic_ring magic_ring st - stitch chain - chain stitch single_crochet - single_crochet slip_stitch - slipstitch space - space pop4 - popcorn with 4 double_crochet close with chain 1 decrease - decrease decrease increase - increase 2 single_crochet in 1 st pico chain 3 slip_stitch through front loop and top loop of the st below between is the stitch count of the row the body of the elephant is crocheted in row turn your work after every row the chain 1 at the beginning of a row does not count as a stitch written instructions in us terms body make 2 row 1 chain 22 22 chain row 2 start in
